results.title: New town
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Commonwealth Teleview”.
Commonwealth Teleview Series - Visiting Harlow, a British satellite town, Christopher Chataway discusses this ‘modern’ building phenomenon with Frederick Gibberd, the city’s architect-planner. Chataway also interviews people living and working in the town, obtaining their views on this experiment in town planning.

results.title: The Commonwealth to the Commonwealth: Dr. Nkrumah
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Commonwealth Teleview”.
In this filmed interview marking the occasion of Ghana’s independence, Dr Kwame Nkrumah, Ghana’s first Prime Minister, answers questions put to him by Robert McKenzie about the nation’s political, economic and social achievements of the past and the present, and talks about this people’s hopes and aspirations for the future.

results.title: Sir Robert Scott
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Commonwealth Teleview”.
Interviewed by Matthew Halton, Sir Robert Scott discusses his work as Britain’s Commissioner-General for South-East Asia. He talks about the importance of the area in Commonwealth and world affairs and some of the forces at work there such as SEATO (South East Asia Treaty Organisation) and the Colombo Plan.

results.title: The Commonwealth to the Commonwealth: Prince Philip's tour 1956
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Commonwealth Teleview”.
The world tour of HRH Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, as described by him on his return during a film and lantern-slide lecture of tour material shown to schoolchildren in London’s Royal Festival Hall. Shows inspection of British survey bases in Antarctica, a visit to a factory whaling ship, to islands in the South Atlantic, to Gambia, Malaya, New Guinea and Australia.

results.title: Uniform circular motion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”
Uniform circular motion is defined and demonstrated. Changes in velocity vector are shown and used to explain why this is accelerated motion. Expression for magnitude of centripetal force is explained in general and illustrated in connection with a body whirling on a string, a car on a loop-the-loop gravitational attraction and motion of electricity charged particle in a magnetic field.

results.title: The U238 radioactive series
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”
The various stages in the decay of U-238 to stable lead. Alpha emission, beta emission and the statistical nature of the process is emphasised. A brief mention is made of other radioactive series.

results.title: Stationary transverse waves
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Animated drawings are used in explaining the nature of stationary waves. Includes demonstrations of pulse reflection at the fixed end of a stretched string, the reflection of a steady wave train at the string boundary, and compounding of oppositely travelling wave trains. Identifies nodes and anti-nodes, and shows the resonance patterns for a stretched string of limited length.

results.title: Simple harmonic motion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Explains simple harmonic motion - the forces to produce it, and the forces it may produce. The mathematic of simple harmonic motion and the relevent motion are examined. For physics students only.

results.title: Nuclear reactor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Discusses nuclear stability and neutron induced fission. Explains neutron emission, self-sustaining chain reaction, and the role of the moderator, Illustrates the application of these ideas to the pile and shows the production of plutonium and tracer elements.
